title: Mandalay was the 'city of gold' - now it reeks of death
snippets: Residents in Mandalay, Myanmar's second-largest city, speak of despair and sleepless nights since last week's earthquake.
summary: Residents of Mandalay, Myanmar's second-largest city, have reported experiencing despair and sleepless nights following an earthquake last week.
titles: Mandalay was the 'city of gold' - now it reeks of death

title: BBC Verify: What satellite images reveal about Myanmar's quake
snippets: Myanmar's military government says at least 2,000 people were killed in last week's 7.7 magnitude quake.
Myanmar's military government says at least 2,000 people were killed in last week's 7.7 magnitude quake.
summary: A 7.7 magnitude earthquake struck Myanmar last week, resulting in at least 2,000 fatalities, according to the country's military government.
titles: BBC Verify: What satellite images reveal about Myanmar's quake

title: Le Pen's right-wing European allies condemn court verdict as threat to democracy
snippets: European rightwingers have voiced support for the French far-right politician after she was banned from running for public office.
summary: European right-wing figures have expressed support for a French far-right politician who has been prohibited from seeking public office.
titles: Le Pen's right-wing European allies condemn court verdict as threat to democracy

title: Iceland volcano erupts after Blue Lagoon evacuated
snippets: The Blue Lagoon and the town of Grindavik were ordered to evacuate after earthquakes hit the area.
summary: After experiencing earthquakes, the Blue Lagoon and the nearby town of Grindavik were mandated to evacuate as a safety precaution.
titles: Iceland volcano erupts after Blue Lagoon evacuated

title: Putin begins biggest Russian military call-up in years
snippets: Russia calls up 160,000 men aged 18-30 as it moves to expand the size of its military.
summary: Russia has initiated a call-up of 160,000 men aged between 18 and 30 years old, aiming to increase the size of its military forces.
titles: Putin begins biggest Russian military call-up in years

title: Breaking down the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game
snippets: Everything you need to know about the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game on Tuesday (6:30 p.m. ET, ESPN2).
summary: The 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game is scheduled for Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. ET and will be broadcast on ESPN2.
titles: Breaking down the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game

title: UConn returns to Final Four behind Bueckers' 31
snippets: Behind 31 points and six assists, Paige Bueckers lifted No. 2 seed UConn to a 78-64 win over No. 1 seed USC in the Spokane 4 regional final, clinching the team's 16th Final Four appearance in 17 years and 24th overall.
summary: Paige Bueckers scored 31 points and provided six assists, leading the No. 2 seed UConn to a 78-64 victory over No. 1 seed USC in the Spokane 4 regional final. This win secured UConn's 16th Final Four appearance in the last 17 years and their 24th appearance overall.
titles: UConn returns to Final Four behind Bueckers' 31

title: With torpedo bat, De La Cruz has 7 RBIs for Reds
snippets: Using a torpedo bat, Elly De La Cruz had a single, double and two home runs with seven RBIs, as the Cincinnati Reds routed the Texas Rangers 14-3 on Monday night, and after the win, manager Terry Francona said, "I think it's more the player than the bat."
summary: Elly De La Cruz led the Cincinnati Reds to a 14-3 victory over the Texas Rangers, contributing a single, double, and two home runs with seven RBIs. Following the game, Reds manager Terry Francona attributed the success more to De La Cruz's skill than to his use of a torpedo bat.
titles: With torpedo bat, De La Cruz has 7 RBIs for Reds

title: Sources: Miles to forgo WNBA draft, enter portal
snippets: After her team's exit in the Sweet 16 on Saturday, Notre Dame guard Olivia Miles has decided to forgo the WNBA draft, despite being projected as the No. 2 overall selection, and enter the transfer portal, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania on Monday.
summary: Following her team's departure from the Sweet 16 on Saturday, Notre Dame guard Olivia Miles will not enter the WNBA draft, where she was expected to be the No. 2 pick. Instead, she has chosen to enter the transfer portal, according to ESPN's Shams Charania.
titles: Sources: Miles to forgo WNBA draft, enter portal

title: Man City star Haaland could miss up to 7 weeks
snippets: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has confirmed that Erling Haaland's doctors estimate he will be out between five and seven weeks.
summary: Manchester City's manager, Pep Guardiola, announced that Erling Haaland is expected to be sidelined for 5 to 7 weeks, according to his doctors' assessment.
titles: Man City star Haaland could miss up to 7 weeks

summary: UK Business Secretary Jonathan Reynolds has issued a warning about a 'very serious and significant moment' for the economy, indicating a critical juncture for financial stability and growth.
titles: Starmer prepares for Trump tariffs as trade deal hopes fade

summary: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced that Brussels is considering measures against Big Tech companies, which could include restrictions on their services exports.
titles: EU brandishes ‘strong plan’ to retaliate against US tariffs

snippets: Swedish fintech brought ‘pay in four’ to everything from food to fashion but sceptics point to model’s vulnerabilities
summary: A Swedish fintech company has expanded the 'pay in four' installment payment model to a wide range of products, including food and fashion. However, there are concerns about the potential vulnerabilities of this payment model.

title: Ten weeks that shook the world
snippets: On many fronts, and with deliberate haste, America is vaporising its soft power
summary: The United States is rapidly diminishing its influence and appeal globally, affecting its ability to shape international outcomes favorably without using force.
titles: Ten weeks that shook the world

title: New warnings of a 'Butterfly Effect' -- in reverse
snippets: A new study warns that global climate change may have a devastating effect on butterflies, turning their species-rich, mountain habitats from refuges into traps. Think of it as the 'butterfly effect' -- the idea that something as small as the flapping of a butterfly's wings can eventually lead to a major event such as a hurricane -- in reverse. The new study also suggests that a lack of comprehensive global data about insects may leave conservationists and policymakers ill-prepared to mitigate biodiversity loss from climate change for a wide range of insect species.
summary: A study indicates that climate change could severely impact butterflies, transforming their diverse mountain habitats from safe havens into traps. It highlights a 'reverse butterfly effect' where minor changes lead to significant consequences. Additionally, the study points out a global data shortage on insects, suggesting that conservationists and policymakers might be under-equipped to address biodiversity loss among insect species due to climate change.
titles: New warnings of a 'Butterfly Effect' -- in reverse

title: New study validates lower limits of human heat tolerance
snippets: Human thermoregulation limits are lower than previously thought, indicating that some regions may soon experience heat and humidity levels exceeding safe limits for survival. The study underscores the urgent need to address climate change impacts on human health, providing vital data to inform public health strategies and climate models.
summary: Recent research reveals human thermoregulation limits are lower than once believed, suggesting certain areas might soon face heat and humidity beyond safe survival thresholds. This study highlights the critical need for addressing climate change's effects on health, offering essential information for public health plans and climate modeling.
titles: New study validates lower limits of human heat tolerance

title: Clinical trial unearths hidden hypertension with automated searches of health records
snippets: A trial of 648 patients found that the new automated method and intervention strategy resulted in nearly four times as many diagnoses and treatment plans for high blood pressure compared with traditional office-based health care visits.
summary: A study involving 648 patients showed that a new automated method and intervention strategy led to almost quadruple the number of high blood pressure diagnoses and treatment plans compared to those identified through standard office visits.
titles: Clinical trial unearths hidden hypertension with automated searches of health records

title: Discovery of Quina technology challenges view of ancient human development in East Asia
snippets: Researchers have uncovered a complete Quina technological system in the Longtan site in southwest China. The discovery challenges the widely held perception that the Middle Paleolithic period was mostly static in East Asia.
summary: Researchers have discovered a complete Quina technological system at the Longtan site in southwest China, indicating that the Middle Paleolithic period in East Asia was more dynamic than previously thought. This finding challenges the notion of a mostly static era in the region's prehistory.
titles: Discovery of Quina technology challenges view of ancient human development in East Asia

title: Study shows groundwater gains in Arizona yet climate risks still threaten water supply
snippets: A combination of water management practices has contributed to notable groundwater gains in Central Arizona despite the region dealing with long-term water stress, according to a new study.
summary: A new study finds that through various water management strategies, Central Arizona has achieved significant groundwater increases, addressing its long-standing water scarcity issues.
titles: Study shows groundwater gains in Arizona yet climate risks still threaten water supply
